title: Horsford Woods Walking Route

images.title: Track in Horsford Woods by Evelyn Simak, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Track in Horsford Woods

images.title: A crossing of tracks in Horsford Woods by Evelyn Simak, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A crossing of tracks in Horsford Woods

images.title: Evelyn Simak / The edge of Horsford Woods
images.caption: The edge of Horsford Woods. Viewed across a large pasture adjoining Green Lane Farm. A wind sock can be glimpsed in mid-distance (at left). The view was taken from Green Lane. Green Lane turns off the B1149, leading east past North Farm and Green Lane Farm from where it turns into an unsurfaced track which traverses Lodge Hill Larch Plantation and Gravelpit Plantation passing Heath Farm. A surfaced road again in its easternmost section the lane connects with the A140 by Horsham St Faith.

images.title: Evelyn Simak / Green Lane viewed from the edge of Horsford Woods
images.caption: Green Lane viewed from the edge of Horsford Woods. The walker can choose between the well maintained forestry road that crosses Horsford woods starting near the B1149 (Holt Road) near the turn-off of Green Lane and leading NE - or take one of the many smaller paths that traverse this expansive woodland in all directions.

images.title: Pastures north of Horsford Woods by Evelyn Simak, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pastures north of Horsford Woods

images.title: Evelyn Simak / Ready for cultivating
images.caption: Ready for cultivating. This field beside Green Lane has been harvested and is now ready for cultivating, weather permitting. The edge of Horsford Woods can be seen in the background.

images.title: Entering Horsford on the B1149 Holt Road by Geographer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Entering Horsford village on the B1149 Holt Road

images.title: Stavros1, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dog public house, Horsford

description: This walk explores Horsford Woods near the Norfolk based village of Horsford. You can start the walk from the car park at the south western side of the site. From here you can pick up several peaceful trails taking you through the forest. From the edges of the woods there are also some fine views of the surrounding countryside. The woods are adjacent to the new Broadland Country Park. You can extend your outing by picking up the waymarked cycling and walking trails to the west. Also to the west is the Marriot's Way. You could pick up this popular shared cycling and walking trail which runs from from Aylsham to Norwich along a disused railway line.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Head into Horsford village and you could enjoy some post walk refreshment at The Dog Inn. The pub has car parking and a nice garden area to sit out in. You can find them at 65 Holt Road with postcode NR10 3DF for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland trails are ideal for a dog walk and the Dog Inn mentioned above also welcomes your four legged friend.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the south west there's Taverham Mill to explore. The mill is a wildlife rich nature reserve with three colour coded walking trails taking you to grassland, woodland, water meadow and a wild flower meadow. The Costessey Circular Walk can also be picked up in this area. There's nice views of the of the valleys of the rivers Wensum and Tud on this easy walk.
